Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 144 of 197 2685 LCHVMAX4
1 I don't really think there would be any need to have them under subpoena. So, yes, the answer is yes.
2
3 THE COURT: Yes. Okay.
4 MS. MOE: Thank you, your Honor. We'll let him know.
5 THE COURT: Okay. Other matters?
6 MS. MOE: Not from the government, your Honor.
7 MR. EVERDELL: Your Honor, I think just over the lunch break the parties are going to confer over some stipulations.
8 And we should hopefully have things hammered out on those when we return. But we'll use the lunch break to do that. We may
9 ask for a little bit more time just to get everything written down and marked properly, but that's the next task.
10
11 THE COURT: Okay.
12
13 I think this is yours, Ms. Menninger. So I will look at during lunch break the application that came in a little before noon for assistance of the marshals to enforce the trial subpoena. And I think we just got the letter from the government.
14
15 Just quickly, Ms. Menninger, I think your -- I just looked very briefly at your declaration, and it indicated that you've made efforts to contact this witness, but there's no details. Do you know if the witness is represented?
16
17 MS. MENNINGER: I do not.
18 THE COURT: Could you pull up the mic. Thank you.
19 MS. MENNINGER: Your Honor, I don't believe the
20
21 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00014250
